title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: India's solar manufacturing capacity about to exceed 125 GW, raising overcapacity concerns
Jyoti Global Plast charts a new flight path with indigenous industrial cleaning drones
Roshni to build Punjab's first giga-scale solar plant
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *Roshni Renewable LLP* plans Punjab's first **giga-scale solar module plant** with an initial capacity of *1.8 GW*, a JV of Valco professionals and Solidus Techno Power.
- The project, built with *Jinchen*, reinforces **Make in India** and reduces reliance on imported solar components.
- It is expected to boost Punjab's industrial ecosystem, generate jobs, and support India's renewable energy transition in the long term.

items.title: Delhivery launches Freight Index One for Indian trucking
items.summary: - Freight Index One provides historical, current, and forward-looking *full truckload pricing* estimates to boost price transparency in India's trucking market.\n- The tool targets transporters, fleet owners, shippers, and 3PLs, drawing on nearly a decade of data and indicators such as *fuel prices*, *toll rates*, and *seasonality* to benchmark rates.\n- CTO Kapil Bharati says data will be shared with industry partners to improve price negotiations and budgeting as more participants feed back into the model.

items.title: Delhivery launches Freight Index One for trucking pricing
items.summary:
- *Delhivery launches Freight Index One* to provide historical, current, and forward-looking *full truckload pricing* estimates. 
- The platform aims to bring **transparency** across major lanes and will share data with shippers, brokers, and logistics partners to enable better budgeting and price benchmarking. 
- Industry officials say wider participation will improve index accuracy as market feedback feeds into the models.

items.title: Britannia appoints Rakshit Hargave as CEO & Exec Director
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Britannia appoints *Rakshit Hargave* as **Executive Director** and **CEO** for a five-year term starting 15 December 2025, reporting to Varun Berry. - Hargave is a veteran of the consumer industry, joining from **Birla Opus** after leading Beiersdorf across ASEAN, ANZ, Africa and serving as MD of NIVEA India. - An IIT Varanasi alumnus with an Electrical Engineering degree and an MBA from **FMS Delhi**, he has been honoured with the Distinguished Young Alumni Award.

items.title: SAIL Bokaro makes first special electrical steel
items.summary:
- The Steel Authority of India Limited's Bokaro Plant produced about *1,100 tonnes* of *0.5 mm* IS 18316 *NGO electrical steel* for the first time, broadening its portfolio of value-added products.
- The *NGO electrical steel* is designed with *low carbon* for ductility and *high silicon* for magnetic efficiency, enabling use in electric motors, generators, transformers, and EV rotors for better energy efficiency.
- The achievement, via the *SMS-II route* with a tailored composition and rolling steps (*HSM* to *CRM-3*), demonstrates SAIL's capability in advanced steels for power, automotive, and renewable energy sectors.

items.title: Sun Pharma Q2 net profit up 3% at ₹3,118 cr
SAEL Industries to invest ₹22,000 crore in Andhra Pradesh
items.summary: - SAEL Industries plans to invest *₹22,000 crore* across *renewable energy*, *biomass*, *data centres*, and *port development* in *Andhra Pradesh*, with a potential to create *over 70,000 jobs*.\n- The investment is expected to be signed at the *CII Partnership Summit* in *Visakhapatnam* (Nov 14–15), and includes seven *solar/BESS* projects totaling *1,750 MW* in *Kadapa* and *Kurnool*.\n- The package also covers a *200 MW biomass project*, a *₹3,000 crore data centre*, and a *₹4,000 crore port project*, with the company already investing *₹3,200 crore* and commissioning *600 MW* in nine months.

items.title: Pavna Industries opens new R&D Centre in Noida
items.summary:
- **Pavna Industries** opened a new *R&D Centre* in *Noida* to bolster automotive innovation and product development. 
- The facility focuses on **electronic components**, **lock systems**, **switches**, and other advanced automotive solutions to meet evolving customer needs and international standards. 
- **Swapnil Jain**, Managing Director, says the centre will accelerate product development, improve efficiency, and strengthen India's position in **advanced automotive engineering** for **OEM** partners and end customers.

items.title: Schaeffler, Neura Robotics to develop humanoids
items.summary:
- Schaeffler and Neura Robotics will jointly develop and supply key components for *humanoids*. 
- Schaeffler plans to deploy a mid-four-digit number of *humanoids* in production by 2035 and expand into AI-driven robotics and related sectors. 
- CEO Klaus Rosenfeld said the move includes portfolio streamlining, including selling the turbocharger business in China, while pursuing AI‑driven humanoid opportunities.

items.title: Blue Star posts profit rise on strong commercial demand
items.summary:
- *2.9% rise in second-quarter profit* driven by strength in the *commercial air-conditioning* segment.
- *Net profit rose to 990 million rupees* and revenue climbed to *24.22 billion rupees*, up *6.4%*.
- *Commercial air-conditioning grew 16.5%* while *residential air-conditioning slid 9.5%* as GST cuts weighed on demand.

items.title: Honeywell Automation's quarterly profit rises on improved demand
items.summary: - Honeywell Automation India posted a 3.8% YoY rise in Q2 profit to 1.20 billion rupees, driven by improved *industrial activity* and execution of existing orders.\n- Revenue from operations rose 12.3% to 11.49 billion rupees, helped by stronger demand for *automation* and incentives for *clean energy*.\n- The broader Indian industrial upturn supported orders for Honeywell's *smart building systems* and other automation solutions.

items.title: Blue Star taps Manish Jha as Group President, Manufacturing
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Manish Jha* appointed as Group President, *Manufacturing* at Blue Star, effective 5 November 2025.
- He is an engineering graduate from *NIT Patna* and MBA from *IIM Indore*, with an APICS certification in Production and Inventory Management.
- With ~26 years at *Tata Motors* and *Tata Cummins*, he will drive the company's manufacturing strategy to boost *efficiency* and *scalability*.

items.title: India invites Romanian firms to join manufacturing ecosystem
items.summary:
- India invites Romanian enterprises to join its dynamic manufacturing ecosystem under *Make in India* and *Production-Linked Incentive (PLI)* schemes.
- The Brașov Forum highlighted expanding bilateral investment across automotive, aerospace, defence, renewables, engineering services and ICT, with MoUs and matchmaking for joint ventures.
- The talks align with a broader India-EU framework, signaling progress toward an *India-EU Free Trade Agreement*, as exports to Romania surpassed *$1.03B* in FY2024-25 and bilateral trade stood at about *$2.98B* in FY2023-24.

items.title: Asia driving global manufacturing recovery, India among leaders
items.summary:
- Asia's manufacturing recovery gained momentum in October, led by *India*, *Thailand*, and *Vietnam* as export demand and orders rebound.
- *India* topped global manufacturing rankings with a *PMI* of 59.2 in October, driven by festive demand and *GST reforms*.
- *Asia ex-China and Japan* *PMI* rose to 52.7, a 14-month high, signaling sustained expansion despite global headwinds.

items.title: Majhi unveils ₹46k crore port and shipbuilding plan in Odisha
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Odisha Chief Minister *Mohan Charan Majhi* announced over **₹46,000 crore** investment to create a new port at **Bahuda** in **Ganjam district** and a **shipbuilding and repair centre** at the **Mahanadi river mouth near Paradip**.
- The package includes **₹21,500 crore** for the Bahuda port and **₹24,700 crore** for the Paradip shipyard, plus a **world-class cruise terminal** at **Puri**.
- These projects are expected to boost trade, tourism and industry, aligning with **Sagarmala**, **Gati Shakti** and the **National Logistics Policy**.

items.title: Deepak Fertilisers Q2 profit up 1.5% on nutrition demand
items.summary:
- DFPCL reported a 1.5% year‑on‑year rise in consolidated net profit to ₹2.13 billion for the quarter ended 30 September 2025, supported by steady demand for its **crop-nutrition** products.
- Revenue from fertilisers and chemicals segments together accounted for more than half of total income, rising 16.2% and 1.5% year on year, with expenses up 10.9% due to higher materials costs.
- Above‑average monsoon rainfall boosted sowing and fertilizer demand in the June–September season, benefiting companies like **DFPCL** that supply both commodity and specialty fertilisers.

items.title: LG plans Make-in-India push for its electronics machinery
Astrophel's cryogenic pump debut at BRICS Summit
items.summary:
- Astrophel Aerospace showcased its indigenously engineered *cryogenic pump* at the **BRICS Innovation Summit** in Moscow.
- Co-founders Suyash Bafna and Immanuel Louis met potential investors to explore export opportunities across BRICS markets as the pump undergoes validation at *ISRO*.
- The project aims to certify dual-use cryogenic hardware for rocket engines and in oil & gas, medical tech, and energy, strengthening India’s export-ready **Make in India** supply chain.

items.title: Volkswagen to develop own assisted driving chip in China
items.summary:
- *Volkswagen* will develop an in-house assisted driving chip for its China operations, marking the first such chip and aimed at reversing sagging sales in the world's largest auto market. 
- The chip's design and production will be handled by a joint venture between *CARIAD* and *Horizon Robotics*, as part of the 'In China, for China' strategy to localize core technologies. 
- The chip is expected in 3–5 years, helping align China tech with VW's global roadmap and shield the group from semiconductor tensions.

items.title: How Maruti’s supplier-first approach laid foundation for India’s $70-billion auto-component industry
Global chip selloff erases $500 billion in value as fears mount
China urges Netherlands to resolve Nexperia issue, protect global semiconductor supply chain
French IDEMIA says India contributing to post-quantum R&D for 5G hardware, algorithms
India-US defence talks in Hawaii
items.summary:
- The 22nd edition of the *India-US Military Cooperation Group (MCG)* is underway in Hawaii, spotlighting *defence cooperation* and interoperability in the *Indo-Pacific*. 
- Senior leaders including **Air Marshal Ashutosh Dixit** and **Lt Gen Joshua M. Rudd** discussed strengthening bilateral engagements and a *ten-year Defence Framework Agreement* signed in Kuala Lumpur, signaling a new chapter in *bilateral relations*. 
- Ministers **Rajnath Singh** and **Pete Hegseth** described the framework as a defining step, signaling a long-term roadmap for shared security goals and closer collaboration.

items.title: Birla Opus Paints CEO Rakshit Hargave resigns
items.summary:
- Birla Opus Paints CEO **Rakshit Hargave** will step down by **December 5, 2025** to pursue opportunities outside the organisation, a move approved by the Nominations & Remuneration Committee and the Board.
- In the interim, **Himanshu Kapania**, MD of **Grasim Industries**, will directly oversee the paints business until a successor is appointed.
- Hargave, who joined in November 2021, helped build the startup phase, establishing six integrated manufacturing facilities and expanding distribution nationwide.

items.title: Like Hanuman, India's EMS must realise its power: Josh Foulger
Grasim Q2 PAT up 76% to ₹553 cr
items.summary:
- Grasim reports a 76% YoY rise in consolidated PAT to *₹553 crore*, driven by strong building materials and **chemicals**.
- Revenue climbs 17% YoY to *₹39,900 crore* and EBITDA grows 29% to *₹5,217 crore*, aided by standalone revenue of *₹9,610 crore* from Birla Opus and Birla Pivot.
- The group remains well-positioned to capitalise on India’s infrastructure growth under *Viksit Bharat*, backed by a diversified portfolio and disciplined capital deployment.

items.title: KPN to invest €5B in Netherlands by 2030, raise dividends
items.author: Reuters - Leo Marchandon, Jakob Van Calster
items.summary:
- *KPN* plans to invest more than **€5 billion** in the Netherlands through 2030, targeting *fibre*, *5G*, *AI* and *cybersecurity*. 
- It will raise dividends from 2026, distributing 80% of *free cash flow*, with **€0.20**/share in 2026 and **€0.25** in 2027. 
- Fibre coverage is set to rise from 70% to 85% of Dutch households by 2030, with capex around **€1 billion** in 2027.

items.title: Building India’s data capital: Why storage will decide AI’s future
Hindalco sees $650 million impact on FY26 cash flow from Novelis fire
Adani Energy Solutions to deliver 60 MW renewable power to RSWM in ₹60 crore agreement
Industrial Transition Accelerator launches India Project Support Programme to advance clean industrialisation
NxtGen launches usage-based sovereign AI platform for faster, low-cost software development
TCS, ABB strengthen 18-year partnership to modernise IT landscape
Mercedes-Benz deploys Celonis to accelerate AI-driven ops
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Mercedes-Benz advanced its digital transformation by deploying the *Celonis Process Intelligence Platform* across its *MO360* digital production platform, increasing visibility across orders, parts, and processes.
- In production, **AI copilots** forecast delivery timelines, optimize sequencing, and minimize delays.
- In after-sales and quality management, process intelligence identifies bottlenecks and flags anomalies to speed responses.

items.title: JSW Steel CEO on met coke import curbs
items.summary:
- *JSW Steel* CEO says they are **self-sufficient on met-coke** and not facing shortages, even as other mills rely on imports.
- The government extended the met-coke curbs with country quotas and a cap of about 1.4 million tons for Jul-Dec, prompting calls for a near sevenfold increase.
- Imports of low-ash metallurgical coke from China, Japan, Indonesia, Poland and Switzerland have surged, pressuring producers to boost domestic sourcing.

items.title: IMFA to buy Tata Steel's ferro chrome plant in Odisha
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- IMFA signed definitive agreements to acquire Tata Steel's ferro chrome plant at Kalinganagar, Odisha for **₹610 crore**, adding **99 MVA** furnace capacity and pushing IMFA beyond **0.5 mtpa**. 
- The 115-acre facility has four furnaces (100,000 tpa each) with potential to reach 150,000 tpa after a fifth furnace, near **chrome ore mines** for cost synergies. 
- Regulatory approvals are pending and the deal is expected to close in about three months; IMFA MD Subhrakant Panda called it **transformational** and said funding would be from **internal accruals**.

items.title: Adani Ports eye 5x logistics revenue by 2029
items.summary:
- APSEZ targets **₹140 billion** in logistics revenue by **FY2029**, five times FY2025, as it expands into *warehousing* and *port-feeder services*.
- Logistics revenue rose **79%** YoY to **11.5%** of total revenue; total revenue reached **₹91.67 billion** and cargo volumes hit **124 million tonnes** on strong domestic demand.
- Diversification hedges against global trade risk, strengthening Adani Ports with multi-revenue streams for long-term resilience.

items.title: Skyworks forecasts upbeat results on mobile-chip demand
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Skyworks forecasts Q1 revenue of **$975 million to $1.03 billion** and **$1.40 per share** in adjusted earnings, above estimates.
- For Q4, revenue was **$1.10 billion**, beating estimates around **$978 million**.
- Growth is driven by **5G iPhones**, AI-enabled devices, and Skyworks' role as a key RF-chip supplier, with potential Qorvo consolidation.

items.title: AMD forecasts fourth-quarter revenue above estimates on strong AI chip demand
Nexperia unsure 'if and when' China unit will send chips, letter to customers says
items.summary:
- *Nexperia* says it cannot "oversee if and when products" from its *Dongguan* site will be delivered and cannot guarantee their quality until it regains supply‑chain oversight.
- The letter describes a formal **force majeure** notification amid the Dutch seizure and long‑standing **global trade tensions** involving Wingtech’s ownership.
- The dispute highlights how chip supply chains remain exposed to political and regulatory actions, with potential longer‑term effects on production and timing.

items.title: Vedanta patents lead- and tin-free alloy
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Vedanta's patent replaces lead and tin with *bismuth* to create a lead- and tin-free aluminium alloy, aligning with environmental standards and phasing out hazardous materials.
- Lab tests show: *8% higher tensile strength*, *21% higher yield strength*, *17% greater hardness*, and up to *30% smoother surface finish* vs conventional alloys.
- The R&D-led alloy targets automotive, electronics, and textiles, supporting *Make in India*, *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, and Vedanta's *Net Zero by 2050* goal.

items.title: Aimtron posts 112% revenue growth
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Aimtron's H1 FY26 revenue up *112.5%* to *₹1,225.8m*, EBITDA up *104.8%* to *₹301.1m*, and PAT up *81.4%* to *₹202.9m*, led by *defence*, *exports*, *IoT* and *ODM*. 
- Order book at *₹4,638.5m* as of 30 Sep 2025, including an *ODM contract* of *₹975.5m* and a domestic AI/IoT order of *₹460m*. 
- Raised *₹945.7m* via convertible warrants for greenfield expansion; earned *AS9100D* certification; MD calls FY26 a turning point.

items.title: HP plans to manufacture all PCs sold in India locally in 3-5 years
M&M, Escorts project 10–12% tractor growth FY26
items.author: Kriti Saraiya, ETAuto
items.summary:
- The Indian *tractor industry* is expected to post *double-digit growth* in *FY26*, with *M&M* and *Escorts Kubota* targeting *10–12%* expansion.
- Rural demand is buoyed by timely *monsoon*, higher *MSPs*, sustained government spend, and *GST cuts* that reduce the cost of *higher-horsepower tractors*.
- *Escorts Kubota* and *M&M* cite momentum in volumes, stockouts for *40–50 HP* models, and planned capex including a near-*Jewar* facility to support growth.

items.title: GST cuts offset US tariffs, boosting manufacturing growth
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- GST rate cuts led to price reductions and increased household spending, *offsetting tariff-related pressure on India's exports*.
- HSBC Global Investment Research notes manufacturing output rising and Q3 CY25 growth at *7.2–7.4%*, with domestic orders supporting growth.
- Exports to the US slipped due to weakness in *jewellery*, crustaceans and textiles, but overall shipments stayed steady thanks to strength in *non-US markets* and high‑tech services.

items.title: India needs advanced tech to boost manufacturing: PHDCCI CEO
items.summary: - *PHDCCI* CEO says India must adopt advanced technologies to strengthen its manufacturing ecosystem and align with the *Viksit Bharat* vision by 2047.\n- An MoU between *PHDCCI* and the Busan Chamber will deepen bilateral trade in *manufacturing*, *clean energy*, *digital tech*, and logistics.\n- With 1.4 billion people and over 65 million MSMEs, India offers vast opportunities for Korean firms in *manufacturing*, *green tech*, and infrastructure.

items.title: Low prices of steel problem for small companies: Secretary
